title: Problem-based learning approach to developing consciousness-level assessment apps

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mobile App Usage Experience and Intermediate-Level Mathematical Concepts
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service teachers to develop mathematical problem-solving skills while experiencing an educational app development process applicable to real-world medical education contexts

learning_goals: Learners can design two or more core features of a consciousness-level assessment app by applying problem-based learning (PBL) methodologies.

Learners can convert the three Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) items (eye response, verbal response, motor response) into mathematical modeling techniques (linear transformation, weighted scoring) and develop a digital assessment system prototype (simple web interface) within one week.

Collaborating in teams of 3â€“4 for one week, learners can analyze two instructional design problems (e.g., UI optimization), apply a problem definition-solution derivation-evaluation process to write a two-page project report, and achieve a "B" (80+ points) grade in at least four out of five report evaluation rubric items.

resources: Low-Code App Development Platform (e.g., MIT App Inventor)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
